content.question: A container filled with gas is sealed on the top with a piston of negligible mass and area <math alttext="0.007 meters squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.007</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. The container and gas are allowed to reach thermal equilibrium with the surrounding air, and a block on top of the piston keeps the piston in equilibrium. If the pressure inside the container is <math alttext="2 times 10 to the 5 power pascals " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the mass of the block?

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
